$

$
About Heartland-Southwest Florida Bluegrass Association of Florida
What are we
?
We are a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization devoted to the promotion, preservation, and appreciation of bluegrass music.
Bluegrass music is one of America's only original forms of music. As such it is worthy of preservation, promotion, and participation by a dedicated group of people. We believe that this music engenders a sense of belonging, encourages musicians and spectators alike to come together and share their love and appreciation for this aspect of Americana. To many of us, it is a “family,” because regardless of where we go to hear or play bluegrass music, we are warmly welcomed and embraced by other bluegrassers.
All contributions to H
SWF
BA are tax-deductible.
​
Our Mission: "To preserve, encourage and promote traditional Bluegrass music and its evolving variants, and to provide a venue and a matrix within which we bring together those persons desiring to preserve, encourage and promote said music."  The link below is an excellent article/history of Heartland by Justin Mason.
​
https://floridabluegrass.net/2019/04/03/heartland-bluegrass-association/
​
MEMBERSHIP APPLICATION
​

About Heartland-Southwest Florida Bluegrass Association of Florida
What are we

We are a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization devoted to the promotion, preservation, and appreciation of bluegrass music.
Bluegrass music is one of America's only original forms of music. As such it is worthy of preservation, promotion, and participation by a dedicated group of people. We believe that this music engenders a sense of belonging, encourages musicians and spectators alike to come together and share their love and appreciation for this aspect of Americana. To many of us, it is a “family,” because regardless of where we go to hear or play bluegrass music, we are warmly welcomed and embraced by other bluegrassers.
All contributions to H
SWF
BA are tax-deductible.
​
Our Mission: "To preserve, encourage and promote traditional Bluegrass music and its evolving variants, and to provide a venue and a matrix within which we bring together those persons desiring to preserve, encourage and promote said music."  The link below is an excellent article/history of Heartland by Justin Mason.

MEMBERSHIP APPLICATION
​
/$

$
$
$
$
Membership
By joining Heartland-Southwest Bluegrass Association of Florida you will be entitled to free admission to stage shows all year long, will receive email updates on all activities of the association, and will receive special rates for camping during Just Jamming weekends each month at Craig's RV in Arcadia, FL. Memberships are automatically a family membership, and yearly dues allow spouse and children of the registered member to attend functions free of charge.
​
We are able to accept registration by mail. Print out and complete the membership form, and mail it with a check for $35 made out to Heartland Bluegrass Music Association of Florida to:
​
Heartland-Southwest Bluegrass Music Association of Florida
11939 Granite Woods Loop
Venice FL 34292
​
CLICK HERE FOR THE MEMBERSHIP APPLICATION:
​
​
​
Please e-mail us!
heartlandsouthwestbluegrass@gmail.com
​
​
​
HBMAF is most grateful and appreciative for all of the support and encouragement given to us by Allen and Vicky Wickey, owners of Craig's RV. They provide us with what we believe to be the finest venue in South Florida for bluegrass events, including camping, stage, concession stand, and even running the soundboard for our stage shows. We are blessed to be able to name them as friends of HBMAF, and friends of bluegrass music.
/$
$
/$
$

$
$
$
/$
$
$
Events
Heartland-Southwest Florida Bluegrass Association's monthly "Just Jammin' " weekends are being held at
www.craigsrvpark.com
on the 4th weekend of each month, unless that weekend conflicts with another major bluegrass event such as a local or nearby festival, or a major holiday weekend.
Check our
Home Page
for dates and events. The weekends offer camping, concession stand on Saturdays,  ongoing jamming at individual campsites, or indoors or under the bluegrass barn roof if the weather is bad. These weekends feature stage shows on Saturday afternoon, guitar workshops, and frequent family-style activities such as potlucks. Admission to stage shows is presently set at $10.00 per person, but is free to anyone holding a current membership in HSWFBA.  The informal jams are open to anyone playing traditional bluegrass instruments, and spectators are always welcome during the jams.
/$
$
Jamming is what bluegrass music is all about. Come be a part of our Bluegrass Bash
/$
